definitions.definition: a hole in the ground dug by an animal such as a rabbit, especially to live in
to dig a hole in the ground, especially to live in:
examples: Rats had burrowed into the bank of the river.

definitions.definition: to move yourself into a position where you can feel warm, comfortable, or safe:
examples: Suddenly shy, our young daughter burrowed her head into my shoulder.

definitions.definition: to search for something, as if by digging:
examples: I burrowed through the clothes in the drawer looking for a clean pair of socks.
